result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Jesus Reyes in court with attorney Matthew Tyler Luening.  Defendant Jesus Reyes in custody.  Jennifer Lynn Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: LNR  
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered case dismissed and read-in to case 17CM696 and 16CF4949 for the purposes of sentencing.

Attorney Matthew Tyler Luening in court, defendant Jesus Reyes not in court, in custody.  Jennifer Lynn Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
In chambers discussion held.  The defense has received a new offer from the State, but has not yet reviewed it with his client. If there is a resolution, plea paperwork shall be filed with the Court no later than 10/20/2017 by 12:00pm.  Case adjourned for status on 10/23/2017 at 8:15am in Branch 17.  Status conference scheduled for October 23, 2017 at 08:15 am.

Attorney David Prado for  Matthew Tyler Luening in court, defendant Jesus Reyes not in court, in custody.  Jack A. Pitzo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: sm

Case in court for status conference. Defense counsel informs the court Branch 17 has accepted this case for purposes of global resolution,.
Court orders this case transferred to branch 17 forthwith and orders matter adjourned.  Status conference scheduled for October 19, 2017 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Matthew Tyler Luening in court, defendant Jesus Reyes not in court, in custody. Jack A. Pitzo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: sm

Case in court for status conference. Court advised defendant has a pending felony matter before Branch 17 and requesting an additional status conference.
Court will authorize transfer of this case to branch 17 for the purposes of a global resolution, if accepted. Case remains calendared in branch 31.  Status conference scheduled for October 12, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Matthew Tyler Luening in court, defendant Jesus Reyes not in court, in custody.  Taylor L. Kraus appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: sm

Attorney Matthew Tyler Luening in court, defendant Jesus Reyes not in court, in custody.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: sm

Defense requests plea and sentencing date.  Case remains calendared in Branch 31.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 12, 2017 at 01:30 pm.
